decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has ways to generate card advantage with cards like Lingering Souls and Mishra's Bauble. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to deal with threats on the opponent's board. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive while also having some interaction and resilience to handle different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board of artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal massive damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves maximizing mana efficiency with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum while utilizing Steel Overseer to pump up the team of creatures. Arcbound Ravager and Inkmoth Nexus provide additional threats and evasion, while cards like Welding Jar and Experimental Frenzy offer protection and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, utilizing cards like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to chip away at their life total. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide both reach and protection for your creatures, while Searing Blaze helps control the board. The overall strategy is to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key cards like Prized Amalgam, Bloodghast, and Narcomoeba. By continually milling cards from the library and bringing back creatures from the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and value spells. Key cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate can finish off the opponent, while Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion help dig through the deck for important combo pieces. This deck relies on synergy between graveyard recursion and creature reanimation to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy of Elves to quickly generate a large number of creatures on the battlefield and then finish the opponent off with a powerful attack, often aided by cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Shaman of the Pack. The deck aims to ramp up mana production with cards like Elvish Archdruid and Heritage Druid, while also maintaining card advantage through spells like Collected Company and Lead the Stampede. By overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of efficient creatures, this deck aims to win the game in a swift and decisive manner.

The deck focuses on spawning a large number of token creatures quickly, pumping them up with Intangible Virtue and other spells, and overwhelming the opponent with a high volume of attackers. Cards like Venerated Loxodon and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional tokens and buffs, while removal spells like Path to Exile and Conclave Tribunal help clear the way for your creatures to attack. The goal is to flood the board with tokens and beat down the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, as well as burn spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt. The goal is to apply pressure early and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Key cards such as Eidolon of the Great Revel and Boros Charm help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your creatures from removal spells. Overall, this deck is designed to win fast and efficiently by focusing on direct damage and aggression.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with a variety of Human creatures while disrupting opponents with cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play, while Noble Hierarch provides mana acceleration. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant pump up the team, making them harder to deal with. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, leveraging the tribal synergy of Humans to gain an advantage in the early game and maintain pressure throughout.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using various counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also uses planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and provide additional control options. The deck aims to survive the early game with cards like Timely Reinforcements and Path to Exile, before stabilizing and taking over the game with powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict. The win condition is often through incremental advantage and card advantage from planeswalkers, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Tireless Tracker, and Grim Flayer, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression while using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Assassin's Trophy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse to maintain control of the game and secure a quick victory.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to trigger abilities of cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By utilizing cards like Shriekhorn and Life from the Loam, the player can constantly dredge cards back from the graveyard and put pressure on the opponent with a steady stream of creatures. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent graveyard-based combo, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate large amounts of mana and cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan while searching for the UrzaTron lands with cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying. Walking Ballista provides a flexible win condition.
